title: UIPL 15-24, Change 1
summary:
UIPL 15-24, Change 1
Panda.Srinivas…
Tue, 08/19/2025 - 08:52

2025
2025

Subject
Permanent Transition of Unemployment Insurance Required Reports (UIR) and Benefit Accuracy Measurement (BAM) Applications from the Unemployment Insurance Database Management System (UIDBMS) to the Unemployment Insurance Reporting System (UIRS)


Purpose
To provide State Workforce Agencies (SWAs) with advance notice of the upcoming permanent transition of the UIR and BAM applications from UIDBMS to UIRS; to provide instructions to SWAs on how to submit data to UIRS; and to advise SWAs that effective December 6, 2025, all states must transmit their UIR data only through UIRS and BAM data only through UIRS starting December 27, 2025.

Active
August 19, 2025


Contact
Please direct inquiries to the appropriate ETA Regional Office.


Originating Office
Select one


Program Office
OUI : Office of Unemployment Insurance


Record Type
Permanent


To
STATE WORKFORCE AGENCIES


From
LORI FRAZIER BEARDENActing Assist

title: Ongoing Government Uncertainty Around Cybersecurity Initiatives Is Putting Your Business At Risk
summary: Government instability is undermining key cybersecurity programs like CyberSentry and MITRE’s CVE cataloging, putting critical infrastructure and business operations at risk. This post explores how funding cuts and conflicting AI directives are creating dangerous gaps in threat detection and response.

summary:
Freedom of association training modules in the Philippines
albarina@ilo.org
Mon, 08/25/2025 - 07:29


Document Type
Training material


Date of Publication
Mon, 08/25/2025 - 12:00



Eyebrow
Rights at work


Brief description
The FOA training modules, developed with tripartite inputs, consolidates ILO- supported tools on FOA and labour rights, integrating new policy insights across five modules and seventeen sessions.




The International Labour Organization (ILO) promotes fundamental principles and rights at work, including FOA, collective bargaining, elimination of forced and child labour, non-discrimination, and the right to safe and healthy work. In the Philippines, efforts to strengthen compliance with ILO Convention No. 87 have advanced through the FOA roadmap adopted by the National Tripartite Industrial Peace Council, following recommendations of the 2023 ILO High-Level Tripartite Mission. To support this commitment, the ILO, through the projects Strengthening Freedom of Assoc

title: Estonia ratifies the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Constitution
summary:
Estonia ratifies the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Constitution
papadhopulli@i…
Fri, 08/22/2025 - 15:41


Document Type
News


Date of Publication
Fri, 08/22/2025 - 12:00



Brief description
On 22 August 2025, the Director-General registered the ratification by Estonia of the 1986 Instrument
of Amendment to the ILO Constitution.




To date, the 1986 Amendment has been ratified by 128 Member States, including two Members of chief industrial importance (India and Italy). To enter into force, the 1986 Amendment must be ratified or accepted by two-thirds of ILO Member States, including at least five of the 10 Members of chief industrial importance. Therefore, three more ratifications from Members of chief industrial importance (from among Brazil, China, France, Germany, Japan, the Russian Federation, United Kingdom and United States) are needed for the amendment to take effect. For more information, see Questions and answers about the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Con
text: Estonia ratifies the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Constitution papadhopulli@i… Fri, 08/22/2025 - 15:41 Document Type News Date of Publication Fri, 08/22/2025 - 12:00 Brief description On 22 August 2025, the Director-General registered the ratification by Estonia of the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Constitution. To date, the 1986 Amendment has been ratified by 128 Member States, including two Members of chief industrial importance (India and Italy). To enter into force, the 1986 Amendment must be ratified or accepted by two-thirds of ILO Member States, including at least five of the 10 Members of chief industrial importance. Therefore, three more ratifications from Members of chief industrial importance (from among Brazil, China, France, Germany, Japan, the Russian Federation, United Kingdom and United States) are needed for the amendment to take effect. For more information, see Questions and answers about the 1986 Instrument of Amendment to the ILO Con

title: Workday to Acquire Paradox. A Bigger Deal Than You Think.
summary:
Today Workday announced the acquisition of Paradox.ai, the pioneer in AI-based conversational recruiting. As I detail in my podcast, this deal could be far more than an addition to Workday’s recruitment offering. It could significantly expand Workday into the front-line worker market, broaden the product portfolio, and deepen Workday’s AI expertise.

Paradox was ... Read more»

title: DOJ Bid to Preempt Illinois E-Verify Law Risks Hit to All States
summary:
DOJ Bid to Preempt Illinois E-Verify Law Risks Hit to All States
Bruce E. Buchanan says a decision overturning the Illinois law banning employers from checking existing employees’ immigration status through E-Verify and finding field preemption of state laws involving workplace immigration issues would likely inspire more lawsuits challenging other state laws, including the red-state E-Verify mandates. Bloomberg LawView (Subscription required)

title: DOJ’s Growing War on ‘Illegal DEI’ Adds Risk to Corporate Hiring
summary:
DOJ’s Growing War on ‘Illegal DEI’ Adds Risk to Corporate Hiring
As the administration increases its scrutiny of IE&D in corporate hiring practices, David Goldstein says companies who see IE&D as core corporate values will defend IE&D practices, others – especially those that rely on federal contracts – will do whatever they can to stay in the administration’s good graces, and everyone else sits in between those two extremes. Bloomberg Law
